title: 'Momsplaining' exclusive: Kristen Bell shares hilarious mom moments with Jennifer Garner
text:
USA TODAY

This might be the most "provocative," down-right real, no sugar-coating-it season of "Momsplaining" yet.

Yes, thank your lucky stars, Kristen Bell is back on Ellen DeGeneres' EllenTube for three more episodes of her comedic video series on motherhood.

Last week, EllenTube gave us sneak peek look at season 4, but perhaps it left you wanting more.

We have an exclusive clip of the first episode that airs Oct. 21. In it, Kristen Bell talks with fellow celebrity mom Jennifer Garner about child birth and IT. IS. HILARIOUS.

The two have "baked" five kids between them, so they sat down with new mamas to talk, well, EVERYTHING.

'It's going to look like a homicide'

One pregnant woman, Emily, shares that she is starting to get a little bit nervous about labor.

"I think it is the most romantic day you'll ever experience," Garner says, clearly trying to be nice. Then Bell chimes in:

"You're a better person than I am because I was going to say, 'It's going to look like a homicide.' There's way more blood than you think there should be."

Bell tells the expectant mom that her best advice for her is to write a birth plan and really take time to think about it. Bell holds up an example of a birth plan, then proceeds to rip it into shreds and toss it aside.

"It's never going to happen like that and so get rid of it," Bell jokes.

Water broke? Not exactly.

At the end of the clip, Bell shares a story about the moment her "water broke." She shares two daughters with her husband and actor Dax Shepard.

"I was standing in the bathroom, my first child, and I was like, 'Honey, my water broke. I'm so excited. Let's call the doctor.' "

At the doctor's office, Bell assured her doctor that there was "big splash" on the bathroom floor.

"Your water didn't break, but it is quite possible that you peed your pants,'" Bell retells her doctor's words.

Too funny.

Catch more episodes of "Momsplaining" on Mondays on ellentube.com and Ellen’s YouTube channel if you want a female anatomy lesson and more real tales of motherhood.

READ MORE
description: Kristen Bell is back for season 4 of "Momsplaining" on "Ellen" and it could be the most provocative yet.
